Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there was no call from Chinese authorities to avoid using American products or traveling to the US.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or official announcement from Chinese authorities regarding the warning against US travels and products.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Chinese authorities made such a warning, but there is no evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the circulation of the screenshot, such as misinformation or a fabricated message.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the severity of the warning by stating that within three months, US products won't be sold, without any basis or supporting evidence.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting a misleading screenshot and attributing it to Chinese authorities without any verifiable source or evidence.
